page.title: 05RIVER ARUN, NORTH PULBOROUGH
page.content: The river Arun flows through pastures in the north west corner of this block. Under normal weather conditions the river is shallow but after heavy rain there is major flooding over the surrounding meadows and the line of the river cannot be seen. This peaceful stretch in the middle reaches attracts a wide variety of bird life; swans ducks and a heron were seen during our visit. The owners of the adjacent Toat House reported that otters and mink were also present. The Horsham Angling Society rent this reach of the river. The river is the boundary between the parishes of Pulborough and Wisborough Green.
